about_the_game:
Trevor Demo

Videohole: Episode II Trevor Demo includes a full exploration of just one of the otherworldly psyche landscapes that you will visit in the course of the full game. The level revolves around the past experiences, imagination, and traumas of, as the name implies, the reclusive do-nothing Trevor. Or are they really like that? Perhaps there's more to this timid soul than meets the eye. Maybe you were way to quick to judge them. Do better. 

While this is the very first "level" you will enter in Videohole: Episode II, it is not exactly where you will begin the full game, however, the content contained in this demo is largely spoiler-free as far as the overarching story is concerned.

Game Features

  • A first-person adventure game with visual novel-depth storytelling and light puzzles.

  • A contained episode with many callbacks and references to Episode I and the larger Episode II story, but does not require previous knowledge to enjoy.

  • An enigmatic mystery that spans a dark forest, with many secrets and Easter eggs to be uncovered while you attempt to escape a looming horror.

  • A story both overt and ambient with collectable lore pieces and documents.

name: VideoHole: Episode II Trevor Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4300U
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 10
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-4710HQ
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 10

short_description: Fall down further. Find them where they have always been. Help them remember. Explore multiple worlds, solve mysteries, and set your retail-hardened will against a mysterious cosmic force in the second installment of the beloved videohole series.
